articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's spy chief was to join his U.S. and Egyptian counterparts and Qatar's prime minister on Thursday for a new round of Gaza ceasefire talks in the Qatari capital Doha, officials briefed on the meeting said.
articles.title: Israel's spy chief due in Qatar for new round of Gaza ceasefire talks

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia began evacuating thousands more people from its border regions on Thursday after Ukraine said it was advancing deeper into the country in a lightning incursion aimed at forcing Moscow to slow its advance along the rest of the front.
articles.title: Russia evacuates thousands more people as Ukraine claims advances

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ksenia Karelina, a Russian-American spa worker, was sentenced to 12 years in prison on Thursday by a Russian court after she was found guilty of treason for donating money to a charity supporting Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia sentences US-Russian citizen Karelina to 12 years in jail for treason

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of women marched across several Indian cities overnight and Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for strict punishment for crimes against women, as outrage and protests against the gruesome rape and murder of a doctor escalated.
articles.title: Protests escalate in India over gruesome rape of doctor

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Talks aimed at achieving a ceasefire in Gaza and a hostage release deal have begun in Doha, an official briefed on the talks told Reuters.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire-hostage release talks begin in Doha, official says

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: The biggest party in Thailand's caretaker government will meet on Thursday to choose a successor for dismissed former premier Srettha Thavisin, as it races to shore up its alliance a day ahead of a pivotal parliamentary vote on a new prime minister.
articles.title: Thailand's Pheu Thai party to decide PM candidate as parliamentary vote looms

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Ruma Paul
articles.description: As cases rise against her, including murder accusations, Bangladesh will decide whether to ask India to extradite former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who resigned and fled to New Delhi last week, the country's de-facto foreign minister Mohammad Touhid Hossain said on Thursday.
articles.title: As cases mount, Bangladesh will decide on seeking Hasina's extradition, adviser says

articles.author: Mohammad Yunus Yawar, Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: The Taliban's supreme spiritual leader said the group had transformed Afghanistan into an Islamic sharia-based country, as the former insurgents marked three years of rule with a huge military parade at the Bagram Air Base near Kabul.
articles.title: Taliban marks three years of rule and sharia law in  Afghanistan

articles.author: Vivian Sequera, Mayela Armas, Tibisay Romero
articles.description: Venezuela's opposition coalition is still pushing for recognition of what it says is its resounding victory in last month's presidential election, but its options are narrowing as international attention is drawn elsewhere, opposition sources and analysts said.
articles.title: Venezuela opposition still aiming for recognition of election win, but options narrow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The deputy leader of South African opposition party the Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) said on Thursday he was resigning to join the party led by former president Jacob Zuma, uMkhonto we Sizwe (MK).
articles.title: Boost for South Africa's Zuma as prominent leftist politician joins his party
